questions.question: What is the primary function of classification in a library?

options.text: To digitize all physical resources for online access.
To arrange information items into a system for easy identification and retrieval.
To categorize library users based on their research interests.
To manage the daily operational schedules of library staff.

questions.answer: To arrange information items into a system for easy identification and retrieval.
questions.explanation: Information organization, primarily through classification, aims to arrange library items into a systematic order, making them easily identifiable and retrievable for users.

questions.question: Which specific classification scheme is utilized at the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library?
questions.explanation: The Library of Congress Classification (LCC) Scheme is explicitly stated as the subject classification scheme in use at the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library.

questions.question: The 'Classification Number' or 'Call Mark' assigned to a library item primarily serves to denote its:

options.text: Physical location on the shelf and subject content.

questions.answer: Physical location on the shelf and subject content.
questions.explanation: The Classification Number or Call Mark is a code that denotes the subject content of a book or item, and it is used to arrange items numerically on the shelves for retrieval.

questions.question: Books on 'Political Science' are assigned which main class letter in the Library of Congress Classification?
questions.explanation: In the LCC scheme, 'H' represents 'Social Sciences', which includes Political Science.

questions.question: The Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library's collection includes over 750,000 volumes of what specific type of resource?
questions.explanation: The library is stated to hold 'over 750,000 volumes of text books'.

questions.question: What are the two broad categories of resources that constitute the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library's general collections?
questions.explanation: The library's collections are broadly categorized into 'Print resources' and 'Non-print resources'.

questions.question: The 'Africana Special Collection' is characterized by its focus on materials of primary interest to which specific field of study?
questions.explanation: The Africana Special Collection is described as being of primary interest to people whose fields of interest are in 'African Studies'.

questions.question: What kind of publications are specifically housed under 'OAU Publications' within the library's print resources?

options.text: Staff publications and theses submitted for higher degrees.
General academic textbooks for OAU courses.
International research papers by OAU affiliates.

questions.answer: Staff publications and theses submitted for higher degrees.
questions.explanation: 'OAU Publications' specifically includes 'Staff publications and theses submitted for higher degrees of the university as well as of other universities'.

questions.question: In the Library of Congress Classification, what does the letter 'Q' represent as a main subject area?
questions.explanation: LCC class 'Q' is designated for 'Science'. R is Medicine, S is Agriculture, and T is Technology.

questions.question: Which LCC main class covers 'Auxiliary Sciences of History'?
questions.explanation: LCC class 'C' is designated for 'Auxiliary Sciences of History'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of dividing main subject areas into sub-classes within the Library of Congress Classification Scheme?

options.text: To limit the total number of books in a class.
To allow for more detailed and specific classification of materials.
To simplify the classification process for new librarians.
To ensure all books are of a uniform size on the shelves.

questions.answer: To allow for more detailed and specific classification of materials.
questions.explanation: The LCC scheme allows for main subject areas to be 'divided or sub divided so that allowances is made for as such details as possible'.

questions.question: Books classified under LCC Classes A-J are housed in which specific wing of the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library?
questions.explanation: The South wing houses books in Class A-J.

questions.question: Books classified under LCC Classes K-Z are housed in which specific wing of the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library?
questions.explanation: The North wing houses books in Classes K-Z.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the 'Acquisitions' function within a library's organizational structure?

options.text: Obtaining new materials for the library's collection.

questions.answer: Obtaining new materials for the library's collection.
questions.explanation: Acquisitions is a sub-unit under 'Collection Services', implying its role in obtaining new materials.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the 'Cataloging' function within a library's organizational structure?

options.text: Creating digital copies of physical books.
Organizing and describing library materials for easy retrieval.
Developing new library programs for the community.

questions.answer: Organizing and describing library materials for easy retrieval.
questions.explanation: Cataloguing is a sub-unit under 'Technical Services', which is responsible for arranging information items into a system for easy identification and retrieval.

questions.question: Classification, in a library context, is defined as the orderly arrangement of items according to their:
questions.explanation: Classification is defined as 'the orderly arrangement of things/ items in classes according to common characteristics'.

questions.question: Which classification scheme is commonly known by the acronym 'UDC'?
questions.explanation: UDC stands for 'Universal Decimal Classification Scheme'.

questions.question: A key feature of the Library of Congress Classification (LCC) Scheme is that its symbols are made up of a combination of:
questions.explanation: The LCC Scheme 'is made up of a combination of letters and numbers'.

questions.question: What is the primary method by which information sources are arranged in the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library to facilitate identification and retrieval?
questions.explanation: The material states that 'The most common way of arranging information items or sources in the library is by classification', and the HOL uses the LCC Scheme for subject classification.

questions.question: What LCC main class is assigned to 'Law'?
questions.explanation: LCC class 'K' is designated for 'Law'.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of displaying 'Recent Accessions' in the library?

options.text: To allow immediate borrowing by all users.
To showcase newly acquired books before integration into the main collection.
To facilitate quick cataloguing by library staff.
To serve as a permanent exhibition of rare books.

questions.answer: To showcase newly acquired books before integration into the main collection.
questions.explanation: Recent Accessions are displayed for several days before being put in the main collection, allowing users to see new additions.

questions.question: Can books displayed as 'Recent Accessions' be borrowed directly from the display?

options.text: No, but they can be reserved at the Loans desk.
Only after a week of display.

questions.answer: No, but they can be reserved at the Loans desk.
questions.explanation: Books on display as Recent Accessions cannot be borrowed directly but can be reserved at the Loans desk.

questions.question: The Conservation Room Collection serves as a depository for which types of materials?

options.text: Newspapers, magazines, and some rare books.

questions.answer: Newspapers, magazines, and some rare books.
questions.explanation: The Conservation Room serves as a depository for newspapers, magazines, and some rare books.

questions.question: Newspapers and magazines in the Conservation Room Collection date back to which period?
questions.explanation: Newspapers and magazines in this collection date back to the early 1960s.

questions.question: The library subscribes to online databases that provide access to which broad categories of information?

options.text: Books, journal articles, newspapers, scientific and business information.

questions.answer: Books, journal articles, newspapers, scientific and business information.
questions.explanation: Online Databases provide access to books, journal articles, newspapers, scientific and business information.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an accessible electronic resource provided by the library?
questions.explanation: Accessible electronic resources include E-books and E-journals.

questions.question: Which online database subscribed to by the library covers 'All disciplines'?

options.text: The New England Journal of Medicine.

questions.explanation: Ebscohost covers 'All disciplines'.

questions.question: For information related to 'Business information', which specific online database is available?
questions.explanation: Marketline provides information for 'Business information'.

questions.question: Which online resource provides access to 'e-journals in French Language'?
questions.explanation: EIFL.Net e-journals provide access to resources in 'French Language'.

questions.question: The 'Document Collection' includes official publications from which Nigerian governmental bodies?

options.text: State Houses of Assembly and Local Government Councils.
Federal Government of Nigeria, Old Regional Governments, and the Federal Capital Territory.
State Governors' Offices and Traditional Rulers' Councils.

questions.answer: Federal Government of Nigeria, Old Regional Governments, and the Federal Capital Territory.
questions.explanation: The Document Collection includes official publications of the Federal Government of Nigeria, the Old Regional Governments, the present State Governments and the Federal Capital Territory.

questions.question: Besides Nigerian government publications, the 'Document Collection' also includes publications from which international organizations?

options.text: United Nations Organisation (UNO) and World Bank.
International Monetary Fund (IMF) and World Trade Organization (WTO).

questions.answer: United Nations Organisation (UNO) and World Bank.
questions.explanation: The Document Collection includes publications from United Nations Organisation (UNO) and the World Bank, among others.

questions.question: The 'Reference Collection' primarily consists of which types of resources?
questions.explanation: The Reference Collection includes dictionaries, encyclopaedia, handbooks, directories, atlases, and university calendars.

questions.question: Where are newspaper clippings (post-October, 1980) and vertical file pamphlet type material kept?
questions.explanation: Newspaper clippings and pamphlet type material are kept in the Reference Room.

questions.question: What additional resource is provided in the Reference Room for periodical articles on Nigerian and African Literature?
questions.explanation: Indexes are provided for periodical articles on Nigerian and African Literature.

questions.question: The 'Serials Collection' consists of which two main categories of journals?

options.text: Current and back files of journals.

questions.answer: Current and back files of journals.
questions.explanation: The Serials collection consists of both current and back files of journals.

questions.question: Where are the 'current journals' from the Serials Collection displayed?

options.text: In the display section of the Serial Room.

questions.answer: In the display section of the Serial Room.
questions.explanation: The current journals are shelved in the display section of the Serial Room.

questions.question: Access to 'Recent back files' (latest 10 years) of journals in the Serials Collection is open to which specific user categories?

options.text: Registered Senior Staff and Postgraduate students.

questions.answer: Registered Senior Staff and Postgraduate students.
questions.explanation: Recent back files are on open access to registered Senior Staff and Postgraduate students who must present the university identity and library cards and sign the register.

questions.question: To access 'Older back files' (journals older than ten years) in the Serials Collection, what is required from readers?

options.text: Obtain and complete a request form at the Serials Section.
Special permission from the University Librarian.

questions.answer: Obtain and complete a request form at the Serials Section.
questions.explanation: For Older back files, readers must obtain and complete a request form at the Serials Section.

questions.question: Which online database is specifically designed for 'Databases of African Theses and Dissertations'?
questions.explanation: DATAD is designed for 'Databases of African Theses and Dissertations'.

questions.question: The collections in the Conservation Room, excluding rare books, are generally of what nature?
questions.explanation: The collections in the Conservation Room, excluding rare books, are of a continuous nature.

questions.question: According to the ALA (2010) definition, a library is primarily a collection of resources organized by information professionals to provide convenient access and to achieve which ultimate goal?

options.text: Preserving historical documents for future generations.
Educating and entertaining a variety of audiences.
Stimulating individual learning and advancing as a whole.
Facilitating the dissemination of research findings globally.

questions.answer: Stimulating individual learning and advancing as a whole.
questions.explanation: The ALA (2010) definition explicitly states the goal as 'stimulating individual learning and advancing as a whole'. While other options are related library functions, this is the specific ultimate goal mentioned in the definition.

questions.question: Which of the following is a core objective of a university library, as stated in the provided material?

options.text: Extending the bounds of knowledge through research.

questions.answer: Extending the bounds of knowledge through research.
questions.explanation: One of the key objectives listed is 'Extenuation of the bounds of knowledge through research by lecturers and other researchers'. The other options are not stated objectives.

questions.question: The Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library's 'Collection Development' department includes which of these units?
questions.explanation: Under 'Collection Development', the listed units are 'Serials' and 'Orders'. The other options belong to different departments.

questions.question: Which type of library is specifically designed to serve the information needs of a particular organization, industry, or specialized field?
questions.explanation: The 'Types of Libraries' section lists 'Special/Research Libraries' as those serving specific, specialized needs, distinct from general public, school, or academic institutions.

questions.question: A student seeking assistance with finding relevant scholarly articles for their thesis would most likely utilize which service provided by the University Library?
questions.explanation: The 'Research Services' section lists 'Literature search service' as directly assisting users in finding relevant scholarly articles for their research. Other options are for obtaining specific documents or language conversion.

questions.question: The 'Technical Services' department of the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library is responsible for:
questions.explanation: Under 'Technical Services', the listed responsibilities are 'Cataloguing', 'Reprography', and 'Bindery'. Lending books is 'Circulation', digitizing is likely 'ICT E-Resources' or 'Research Development', and e-resources access is 'ICT E-Resources'.

questions.question: Beyond providing physical books, a key importance of the library in a university setting is offering access to:
questions.explanation: The 'Importance of the Library' section highlights 'access to various electronic and ICT resources' as a key benefit, enabling modern research and study.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT explicitly listed as a unit under 'Research Development' in the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library's organization?
questions.explanation: 'Serials' is listed under 'Collection Development', not 'Research Development'. The other options are all explicitly listed under 'Research Development'.

questions.question: The service known as 'SDI' in university libraries stands for:
questions.explanation: SDI is an acronym for 'Selective Dissemination of Information', a service that provides tailored updates to users based on their specific interests.

questions.question: Who is the highest administrative head of the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library, according      to its organizational structure?
questions.explanation: The 'Organisation of the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library' section lists the 'University Librarian' as the top administrative position.

questions.question: Which section within the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library is primarily responsible for the direct lending and return of library materials?
questions.explanation: Circulation is the unit specifically mentioned under 'Readers Services' for lending and returning materials.

questions.question: The process of acquiring new books and journals for the library's collection falls under which main department?
questions.explanation: 'Collection Development' is responsible for 'Serials' and 'Orders', which relate to acquiring materials.

questions.question: If a student needs to access digital academic papers and multimedia files provided by the library, they would typically find these under which department?
questions.explanation: 'ICT E-Resources (Repository)' explicitly lists 'Repository', 'Software/E-Resources', 'Hardware', and 'Multimedia' as its units.

questions.question: The physical preparation of library materials, such as binding and cataloguing, is handled by which department?
questions.explanation: 'Technical Services' includes 'Cataloguing', 'Reprography', and 'Bindery', all related to physical preparation.

questions.question: Which unit within the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library focuses on collecting and preserving historical documents related to the university itself?
questions.explanation: 'University Archives' is specifically listed under 'Research Development' for preserving university-related historical documents.

questions.question: A library, as defined by George Eberhart, is characterized by its collection of resources being organized by whom?
questions.explanation: The definition explicitly states 'organized by information professionals or other experts'.

questions.question: One of the objectives of the university library is to ensure that faculty and students achieve high academic honour and a good reading habit by:
questions.explanation: The objective states 'Enabling the faculty and students to achieve highest academic honour and lifetime good reading'. This implies providing the resources to do so, further supported by 'Acquiring process of resources and make them available to the readers/users'.

questions.question: If a researcher needs to obtain a document that is not available in the Hezekiah Oluwasanmi Library's collection, which service would they most likely use?
questions.explanation: 'Inter-library loan services' are specifically for obtaining materials from other libraries.

questions.question: Which type of library primarily serves the general public with a wide range of materials and services for all ages?
questions.explanation: Public libraries are designed to serve the general public, as implied by their name and common understanding.

questions.question: Besides providing resources, a university library is important because it offers students and lecturers a quiet place to:
questions.explanation: The 'Importance of the Library' section states 'it offers a quiet places to study as well as access to various electronic and ICT resources'.
